19.69.text:
I begin with the Chorus’s speech from the
start of Henry V (1599), not just because

25.14.text:
it is one of the best beginnings ever written
for anything, but because it is central to

29.40.text:
my topic this afternoon in ways that are both
intellectual and autobiographical. What I

35.41.text:
want to do over the next hour is look at three
propositions according to which different

40.84.text:
national theatre institutions have emerged,
and in particular the extent to which those

46.79.text:
different theatres have plausibly appealed
to Shakespearean precedent. In the process

52.93.text:
I will be glancing at some theatres in continental
Europe, in North America and in Australia,

58.55.text:
but I will mainly be concentrating on Ireland
and the more-or-less United Kingdom, where

64.01.text:
these rival rationales for nationalized theatre
have overlapped and competed in particularly

70.06.text:
interesting ways. It’s a subject with an
obvious relevance to this town, and indeed

76.45.text:
to the job into which this lecture is supposed

82.09.text:

the birth of William Shakespeare.’ If the

117.19.text:
feigning to find the makeshift Globe inadequate

123.18.text:
Shakespeare pictures an entire country transformed

130.04.text:
most of the remainder of this lecture will

134.65.text:
was and wasn’t realized over the three centuries

140.04.text:
with one instance in which the three different
paradigms I am going to outline strikingly

145.78.text:
converged. There will then be a post-war epilogue,
and a toast. (If you want a more informal

152.94.text:
title for this paper, by the way, it’s Several
Statues and a Carpet, but more on those later).

441.08.text:

446.84.text:

457.50.text:

By the time the warlike Harry is assuming

480.82.text:

Something of the combined impression that

493.41.text:

498.26.text: poem elsewhere in the First Folio.

500.17.text:
Triumph, my Britain! Thou hast one to show

509.06.text:
For Jonson, all playwrights seem to be engaged

515.55.text:

526.39.text:

531.45.text:

537.58.text:
both this couplet and the prologue to Henry

548.35.text:

555.85.text:

615.07.text:

619.32.text:

624.75.text:

654.49.text:

royal site, by the Palais Royal, in another

723.37.text:

a duopoly, rigging the market so as to make

809.43.text:
Company and the Duke of York’s Company had

Shakespeare’s own company were nominally
royal from 1601 onwards, and after the Civil

826.46.text:
Wars so were the two Theatres Royal, but they

837.25.text:

854.46.text:
the continent, the royally-supported court

859.80.text:

865.79.text:

871.30.text:
problem to which a national theatre had to

881.74.text:
This 
is not to say that Drury Lane in particular

891.43.text:

in the mid-eighteenth century, indeed, it

One quite different paradigm for the establishment

925.34.text:

the professional base of someone who personally

on earth more than twenty years ago, but what

1006.71.text:

1018.52.text: and efficiently in a series of images.

This picture, a favourite of our dear colleague

In ‘The Rival Printers,’ 1728, in the

1063.84.text:
